channel.title: Saphire
channel.description:
Saphire. Most of you guys know him. He won't be back for a year or two. He has been sent to jail for attacking a guy with a golf club. You might be wondering why the fuck did he do that. Well, this guy hit his girlfriend/mate. So he wanted to defend her. So, he attacked her with a golf club. So yeah.. Expect to not get anything that he owes you.
P.S. He already sent the notebook.

item.title: Saphire
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

[quote=“Daginith, post:85, topic:435115”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=537834.msg3935849#msg3935849 date=1331051629]

only needs three of these:

But total moron hopefully when he gets out he will have learned something.
[/quote]I am under the assumption your a chick (considering your name/and most gmods on here are xD )

so your saying you wouldn’t want to be defended by your “guy” ?

Lmao, because we all need to continue the patriarchal society where testosterone-driven males need to prove their dominance both over women and other men by beating other men up. What a fantastic way to solve problems in the world! Yay for complete idiocy, lack of common sense, and emotional decision making!

I pretty much lost most of my respect for the guy after hearing about this. Yeah, if someone went after my girlfriend or vice versa, one of us would do whatever it takes to seek justice. How the fuck can that entail taking a golf club and using it on the culprit so intensely that you land in jail for 2 years? That doesn’t even make sense to me. Saphire` would have had to nearly kill the guy, in which case, he needs some serious anger management.

Battery.

http://www.ehow.co.uk/way_5282959_common-assault-sentencing-guidelines.html

I apologize for mentioning that david was the one that brought up common sentencing guidelines before. I should have said Chassy.

[/quote]

Too bad you’re using that meme wrong.

Read full topic

item.title: Saphire
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Daginith, post:91, topic:435115”][quote author=t4 link=topic=537834.msg3936311#msg3936311 date=1331072616]

http://www.police.uk/crime/?q=Troedyrhiw,%20Merthyr%20Tydfil%20CF48%204HG,%20UK#crimetypes/2011-12

No records of any un-normal (as in, places where crimes hadn’t occurred before) crimes last month.
[/quote]Anyone have anything to counter? A credible news source would be best I think

Since when is being anti-social a crime?

anti-social and asocial are two completely different things.

I’m still confused, it says anti-social there. What asocial?[/quote]
asocial behavior is basically being an extreme introvert (not wanted to be around others/keeping to yourself). anti-social behavior is basically a lack of compassion or empathy for others (animals and humans).

Common assault is a criminal offence in Britain and other countries in the British Commonwealth of Nations. Common assault occurs when person A makes person B believe or fear that A is about to do violence against B. The offence occurs when one party...
